intro: Leptolobium bijugum, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. The seeds are enclosed in a pod and are often dispersed by animals or through wind.
